intro: Valeriana gilliesii, commonly known as the New Zealand valerian, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, often fragrant leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in forest understoreys and along stream banks, thriving in moist, shaded environments. Its roots are used in traditional Māori medicine for their sedative and calming properties. Valeriana gilliesii plays an important ecological role in supporting local insect and bird populations.
